__e: I don't believe anyone's ever accused me of being a truck driver before.

We got into this big fight, and he said the worst thing anyone's ever said to me. He accused me of being terminally unhappy. As I thought and thought about how he could say such a thing, I realized that he knew:
Lexington P.D. Lieutenant just accused me of being responsible for his kid's dope problem.
Instead of being honest with me and telling me what was really going on in your messed-up head, you accused me of being obsessed with your fat... again!
You see, the thing is, someone accused me of doing something bad at work and I didn't do it.
For starters, the kid said his dad accused him of stealing money, but that can't be right, 'cause the dad knew that the sister took it.
At least this woman wasn't in the room when you accused her dead husband of murdering her sister.
Then, I can't be sure, but I think he actually seemed to accuse the father, at least briefly.
That way, he would indict the system and achieve something by his death over and above what the death itself achieved.
